Portfolio Question.question: What portfolio does this application fall under?

answer_array: The workload is an existing one
The workload is a new component of an existing app
Workload Description.question: Which of the following best describes your workload?

Existing App.question: If existing, where is the current hardware/processing located?

App Retirement.question: Are there plans to retire the application in the next 12 months?

answer_array: New app/split functionality or channels from existing app to new VSAD
New service/functionality, not already represented in the application
Platform Change (Solaris <-> Linux, instance to containers, convert to serverless)
Cost evaluation, including CapEX <-> OpEx changes
External factors (anti-pattern for existing provieer, data center limits, non-directional data center
Circumstances.question: What circumstances are driving a workload placement evaluation?

Impact on App.question: Explain the impacted components and overall impact to the application anticipated by this change. If this is a new service component for the application or a departure from the description in VAST, describe those changes. If an external factor triggered this evaluation, please proivde those details as well.

Data Regulation Check.question: Does the data associated with this workflow require special handling/restrictions for regulation (FISMA/PCI/...)?

All Restricted.question: Is all of the data associated with this workflow restricted?

Same Provider.question: Will same components for all environments (NP/PLE/Prod) be in the same provider? (hint: NP in cloud, prod on-premise)

Receive Data.question: Will this application receive data from other applications?

Receive Data Long Answer.question: If so, what are those applications, where are they located at and how much data will be transferred on any given work day?

Send Data.question: Will this application send data to other applications?

Send Data Long Answer.question: If so, what are those applications, where are they located at and how much data will be transferred on any given work day?

answer_array: Application team can support the Full Stack
Application team with Business Unit TechOps/SRE team that can support the Full Stack
OS Support.question: Will the application team reqiuire OS (sysadmin) support or will the application team members be able to fulfill this role?

Workload Characteristics.question:
What are the workload characteristics of this application? 
 Is the workload static, batch processing, bursty in nature or are there special events that will require scale up for short periods of time?

answer_array: No, manual installation or configuration steps are needed in portions of my application
CI/CD.question: Is your application installation and configuration CI/CD based?

Tiers.question: Are the tiers of this application on distinct instances?

Public Facing.question: Is the application public facing? (Red/Yellow Zone network required)

answer_array: Specialized CSP services (describe in the textbox)
Services Required.question: What "services" do you require?

Database.question: If this application requires a database, what type of DB is it?

MS SQL DB.question: Is the MS SQL DB space under 16 TB per instance?

answer_array: We do not have DBA team members and require a managed service
DBA.question: If this application requires a database does the application have a DBA to manage the engine (installation/patching/tuning)?

answer_array: 1 to 32 vCPUs with 1 to 128 GB RAM
Larger than 32 vCPUs or larger than 128 GB RAM
Compute Instances.question: If this application requires standard compute instances, how big is the largest compute instance?

OS Required.question: If this application requires standard compute instances, what OS is required?

Specialized Hardware/Services.question: Will the following specialized cloud services or hardware be needed?

Purchase or Not.question: Will the workload fit on  an on-premise virtualized environment or will a purchase be needed?

CPU Question.question: <= 32 CPUs and <= 128g memory per instance needed?
